page.title: 12FARMING NEAR PETERLEE
page.content: On the farm you have to get up and about 6o'clock to feed all the animals-horses, pigs, cows, geese and ducks. The fields have to be ploughed and seeded. You can seed them by hand but the quickest way is by the tractor with a spreader on the back. A tractor is powered by diesel and they cost a lot. In the summer the grass gets cut and mowed for hay. To make hay you need a tractor, hay bailer, sreader, cutter and sun. First you need to wait until the grass grows and then you cut it, spread it and wait until it is dry. Then it is bailed and kept in the barn for the horses to feed on. Geese have to be carefully looked after. If you have geese you have to lock them away at night so the fox does not get them.
